cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating west-northwest across the southwest Atlantic, aiming toward the Carolina and mid-Atlantic coast late week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of North Carolina or northeast South Carolina

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern and mid-Atlantic U.S. coastline from South Carolina through Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely (40–60 mph) with a 49 % chance in the next five days, highest Friday–Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 3–5 ft surge in tidal waterways and Chesapeake Bay if the hurricane tracks near the coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall bands could produce 4–8 inches with locally higher totals, causing flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and possible coastal flooding that may disrupt port operations
